metadata.name: Simple Line-Item Retrieval Questions
metadata.description: Comprehensive S&P 500 evaluation dataset with 496 companies including Alphabet (fixed critical data quality issue)
validation_rules: All questions must complete within max_response_time_ms
Numeric answers must be within specified tolerances
Text answers must match exactly or be in alternatives list
major_fixes: Fixed punctuation suffix bug in company name normalization
Added Alphabet (GOOGL) and 40+ other missing S&P 500 companies
Updated from 455 to 496 companies (98.6% S&P 500 coverage)
Improved estimated runtime from 60 to 15 minutes (proper database approach)

questions.question: How many S&P 500 companies are in the Information Technology sector?

optimal_sql_query.description: Count companies in Technology sector using GICS classification
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT COUNT(*) as company_count
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv'
WHERE gics_sector = 'Information Technology'
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Simple aggregation on indexed sector column. Expected runtime <100ms.

questions.question: Which sector has the most companies in our S&P 500 dataset?

optimal_sql_query.description: Find sector with maximum company count using aggregation
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT gics_sector as sector, COUNT(*) as company_count
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv'
WHERE gics_sector IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY gics_sector
ORDER BY company_count DESC
LIMIT 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: GROUP BY with ORDER BY on aggregated result. Efficient for small dataset (<500 companies).

questions.question: How many companies are incorporated in Delaware?

optimal_sql_query.description: Count companies incorporated in Delaware using state of incorporation field
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT COUNT(*) as company_count
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv'
WHERE stprinc = 'DE'
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Simple aggregation on state of incorporation field. Very fast with proper indexing.

questions.question: What currency is used most frequently in the numerical data?

optimal_sql_query.description: Find most frequently used currency in numerical financial data
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT uom as currency, COUNT(*) as usage_count
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet'
WHERE uom IS NOT NULL
  AND (uom ILIKE '%USD%' OR uom ILIKE '%EUR%' OR uom ILIKE '%CAD%' OR LENGTH(uom) = 3)
GROUP BY uom
ORDER BY usage_count DESC
LIMIT 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Aggregation on unit of measure field. Filter for currency-like values to improve accuracy.

questions.question: How many financial facts have footnotes?

optimal_sql_query.description: Count financial facts that have footnote references
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT COUNT(*) as facts_with_footnotes
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet'
WHERE footnote IS NOT NULL
  AND TRIM(footnote) != ''
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Simple count with NULL check on footnote field. Consider indexing footnote field for better performance.

questions.question: Which company has CIK 0000066740?

optimal_sql_query.description: Lookup company name by specific CIK identifier
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT name as company_name
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv'
WHERE cik = '0000066740'
   OR cik = '66740'
UNION
SELECT DISTINCT c.name as company_name
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/sub.parquet' s
JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = s.cik
WHERE s.cik = '0000066740'
   OR s.cik = '66740'
LIMIT 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: CIK lookup with fallback to submission data. Handle CIK with/without leading zeros.

                      'NM','NY','NC','ND','OH','OK','OR','PA','RI','SC',
                      'SD','TN','TX','UT','VT','VA','WA','WV','WI','WY','DC')
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Uses NOT IN clause to exclude US states. Consider creating lookup table for better performance.

questions.question: What percentage of companies are incorporated in the US?

optimal_sql_query.description: Calculate percentage of US-incorporated companies
optimal_sql_query.query:
SELECT 
    ROUND(
        (COUNT(CASE WHEN stprinc IN ('AL','AK','AZ','AR','CA','CO','CT','DE','FL','GA',
                                     'HI','ID','IL','IN','IA','KS','KY','LA','ME','MD',
                                     'MA','MI','MN','MS','MO','MT','NE','NV','NH','NJ',
                                     'NM','NY','NC','ND','OH','OK','OR','PA','RI','SC',
                                     'SD','TN','TX','UT','VT','VA','WA','WV','WI','WY','DC') 
                     THEN 1 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*)), 1
    ) as us_incorporation_percentage
FROM 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv'
WHERE stprinc IS NOT NULL
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Percentage calculation with CASE statement. Consider materialized view for repeated queries.

questions.question: Which S&P 500 company has the highest gross profit margin?

optimal_sql_query.description: Find S&P 500 company with highest gross profit margin
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH gross_margins AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    n.cik,
    c.name as company_name,
    n.val as gross_margin_value,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY n.cik ORDER BY n.ddate DESC, n.fy DESC, n.fp DESC) as rn
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' n
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = n.cik
  WHERE n.tag ILIKE '%GrossProfit%Margin%'
     OR (n.tag ILIKE '%GrossProfit%' AND n.uom LIKE '%Percent%')
    AND n.val IS NOT NULL
    AND n.val > 0
)
SELECT company_name, gross_margin_value
FROM gross_margins
WHERE rn = 1
ORDER BY gross_margin_value DESC
LIMIT 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Complex JOIN with window function. Consider creating derived table for gross margin calculations.

optimal_sql_query.description: Get most recent StockholdersEquity for specified company
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH company_cik AS (SELECT cik FROM 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' WHERE [COMPANY_FILTER] LIMIT 1)
SELECT n.val, n.ddate FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' n
JOIN company_cik c ON c.cik = n.cik
WHERE n.tag = 'StockholdersEquity' AND n.qtrs = 0 AND n.val IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY n.ddate DESC LIMIT 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: JOIN with date ordering. Replace [COMPANY_FILTER] with appropriate company identification.

questions.question: What is Apple's Return on Assets (ROA) for the latest period?

optimal_sql_query.description: Query Assets data for companies
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH latest_data AS (
  SELECT 
    n.cik,
    n.val,
    n.ddate,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY n.cik ORDER BY n.ddate DESC) as rn
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' n
  WHERE n.tag = 'Assets' AND n.qtrs = 0 AND n.val IS NOT NULL
)
SELECT 
  c.name as company_name,
  ld.val as assets_value
FROM latest_data ld
JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = ld.cik
WHERE ld.rn = 1
ORDER BY ld.val DESC
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Window function to get latest Assets values. Consider partitioning by fiscal year for better performance.

questions.question: What is Tesla's gross margin for the latest period?

optimal_sql_query.description: Calculate or find company with highest gross profit margin
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH gross_margin_calc AS (
  SELECT 
    n.cik,
    c.name,
    (gp.val / rev.val) * 100 as gross_margin_pct
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' gp
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' rev ON gp.cik = rev.cik AND gp.ddate = rev.ddate
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = gp.cik
  WHERE gp.tag = 'GrossProfit' AND rev.tag = 'Revenues'
    AND gp.qtrs = 0 AND rev.qtrs = 0
    AND gp.val > 0 AND rev.val > 0
)
SELECT name, gross_margin_pct FROM gross_margin_calc ORDER BY gross_margin_pct DESC LIMIT 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Complex calculation with multiple JOINs. Consider materialized view for ratio calculations.

questions.question: Which sector has the highest average operating margin?

optimal_sql_query.description: Find highest operating margin by sector or company
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH operating_margins AS (
  SELECT 
    c.name,
    c.gics_sector,
    (oi.val / rev.val) * 100 as operating_margin_pct,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY (oi.val / rev.val) DESC) as rn
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' oi
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' rev ON oi.cik = rev.cik AND oi.ddate = rev.ddate  
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = oi.cik
  WHERE oi.tag = 'OperatingIncomeLoss' AND rev.tag = 'Revenues'
    AND oi.qtrs = 0 AND rev.qtrs = 0 AND oi.val > 0 AND rev.val > 0
)
SELECT name, gics_sector, operating_margin_pct FROM operating_margins WHERE rn = 1
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Multi-table calculation with ranking. Expensive query - consider caching results.

questions.question: Which company has the highest operating cash flow in the latest period?

optimal_sql_query.description: Analyze cash flow metrics for companies
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH cash_flow_data AS (
  SELECT 
    cf.cik,
    c.name,
    cf.val as operating_cash_flow,
    cf.ddate
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' cf

)

questions.question: What is Tesla's debt-to-equity ratio?

optimal_sql_query.description: Calculate debt-to-equity ratios for companies
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH balance_sheet_data AS (
  SELECT 
    debt.cik,
    c.name,
    debt.val as total_debt,
    equity.val as stockholders_equity,
    debt.val / equity.val as debt_to_equity_ratio
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' debt
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' equity ON debt.cik = equity.cik AND debt.ddate = equity.ddate
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = debt.cik
  WHERE debt.tag = 'LongTermDebt' 
    AND equity.tag = 'StockholdersEquity'
    AND debt.qtrs = 0 AND equity.qtrs = 0
    AND debt.val > 0 AND equity.val > 0
)
SELECT name, debt_to_equity_ratio
FROM balance_sheet_data
ORDER BY debt_to_equity_ratio DESC
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Multi-table ratio calculation. Consider materialized view for financial ratios.

questions.question: Which S&P 500 company has the highest free cash flow yield?

optimal_sql_query.description: Analyze cash flow metrics for companies
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH cash_flow_data AS (
  SELECT 
    cf.cik,
    c.name,
    cf.val as operating_cash_flow,
    cf.ddate
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' cf
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = cf.cik
  WHERE cf.tag = 'NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities'
    AND cf.qtrs = 0 AND cf.val IS NOT NULL
  ORDER BY cf.ddate DESC
)
SELECT name, operating_cash_flow
FROM cash_flow_data
ORDER BY operating_cash_flow DESC
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Cash flow analysis with date ordering for latest values.

questions.question: What is Coca-Cola's current ratio?

optimal_sql_query.description: Calculate current ratio (current assets / current liabilities)
optimal_sql_query.query:
WITH current_ratio_calc AS (
  SELECT 
    ca.cik,
    c.name,
    ca.val / cl.val as current_ratio
  FROM 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' ca
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500_parquet/num.parquet' cl ON ca.cik = cl.cik AND ca.ddate = cl.ddate
  JOIN 'data/s_and_p_500/comprehensive_companies.csv' c ON c.cik = ca.cik  
  WHERE ca.tag = 'AssetsCurrent' AND cl.tag = 'LiabilitiesCurrent'
    AND ca.qtrs = 0 AND cl.qtrs = 0 AND ca.val > 0 AND cl.val > 0
)
SELECT name, current_ratio FROM current_ratio_calc ORDER BY current_ratio DESC
optimal_sql_query.performance_notes: Liquidity ratio calculation with multiple table joins.
